Pi Lit Tutors

Located in Guelph, Ontario

How the tutoring sessions might work....

  • Choose one of our packages outlined on the home page.
  • Book an hour of English and/or Math, as a one time only session or a weekly session.
  • Book an hour with PiLitTutors and have 30 min of English help and 30 min of Math help.
  • Organize a group session with up to 2 friends at no additional cost.
  • Meet us at a public library of your choosing in Guelph, Ontario.

The Tutors

The "Pi"

Ellen McConomy, OCT

Ellen began her career in 1986, as a full-time Mathematics teacher at Newtonbrook Secondary School in Toronto, Ontario. At that time, there was a surplus of teachers in Toronto and after 2 years she was placed at George S. Henry Academy where she taught various sections of Math, Science, Co-op, Guidance and Physical Education. With 25 years experience she decided it was time to return to her roots - full-time mathematics. For the remainder of her career, Ellen enjoyed the challenge of the Mathematics classroom and continued to improve her teaching practice by completing online courses with Stanford University and working on the Ministry of Education's Renewed Math Strategy program. Ellen retired from the Toronto District School Board in 2018 and is currently learning computer programming at home.

The "Lit"

Roberta Belfry, OCT

Roberta worked as a high school English teacher for over twenty years in the Toronto District School Board. She was the Head of English, ESL and Moderns for the last part of her career and is now ready to share her discoveries one-on-one. She also taught Dramatic Arts, Humanities and Guidance courses and worked for three years as the Head of Student Success including delivering Credit Recovery classes. As a result of Roberta's hard work, the EQAO scores in her school improved by 9% over the last eighteen months. She retired in June of 2019 and is looking forward to working towards becoming a professional photographer.

Terms and Conditions

We want you to be excited about Math and English!

  • You must bring your class notes and any textbooks with you to each session.
  • Payments must be made via etransfer before the sessions begin and we will accept it at the end of the session.
  • Please give at least two hours notice to cancel or reschedule a session.
